title: Standard options for creating a Higher Expectations vignette. — CHUNK_OPTIONS_FOR_KNITR
Standard options for creating a Higher Expectations vignette. — CHUNK_OPTIONS_FOR_KNITR
text: list 8 elements `collapse = TRUE` Try put source output block one code chunk. `warning = FALSE` show warning messages output. `message = FALSE` show informational messages output. `comment = "#>"` Text appended every outputted line code. `cache = TRUE` Re-use calculations chunks changed. `dpi = 96` Render graphics web-friendly resolution. `fig.dim = c(width = 7, height = 4)` Pleasing defaults figure sizes. `dev = c("png", "pdf")` Cache `png` `pdf` outputs, use pngs vignette.

title: Standard options for creating a Higher Expectations vignette. — CHUNK_OPTIONS_FOR_KNITR

title: Create a data frame for putting labels on a graph. — annotation_table
text: data frame fields “Name“, “Measure“, “Value“, “Label“

title: Create a data frame for putting labels on a graph. — annotation_table
code: racine_laus |>     purrr::pluck("wisconsin") |>     dplyr::mutate(Parsed = list(laus_parse_series(.data$Series))) |>     tidyr::unnest("Parsed") |>     dplyr::select("measure_code", "Year", "Month", "Value") |>     dplyr::filter(.data$Month == "January") |>     annotation_table("Year", 2020, "measure_code") #> # A tibble: 6,192 × 4 #>    measure_code  Year Month     Value #>           <int> <dbl> <fct>     <dbl> #>  1            5  2020 January 2981617 #>  2            5  2020 January 2981617 #>  3            5  2020 January 2981617 #>  4            5  2020 January 2981617 #>  5            5  2020 January 2981617 #>  6            5  2020 January 2981617 #>  7            5  2020 January 2981617 #>  8            5  2020 January 2981617 #>  9            5  2020 January 2981617 #> 10            5  2020 January 2981617 #> # ℹ 6,182 more rows

text: string query part Census API call

title: Construct the query part of the URL for a call to the US Census API — census_api_query
code: census_api_query(paste0("B25003_00", 1:3, "E"),                  "tract",                  "*",                  state = 55L,                  county = 101L) #> [1] "B25003_001E,B25003_002E,B25003_003E&for=tract:*&in=state:55&in=county:101"  census_api_query(paste0("P1_00", c(1, 3, 4), "N"),                  "block%20group",                  "*",                  state = 55L,                  county = 101L) #> [1] "P1_001N,P1_003N,P1_004N&for=block%20group:*&in=state:55&in=county:101"

what: Create an API call to send to api.census.gov — census_api_url
title: Create an API call to send to api.census.gov — census_api_url
text: Create API call send api.census.gov

title: Create an API call to send to api.census.gov — census_api_url
code: census_api_url(   variables,   for_geo,   for_items,   survey_type,   survey_or_table_code,   year,   ... )

title: Create an API call to send to api.census.gov — census_api_url
text: variables vector variables for_geo single geographic level, like "tract" "block" for_items specific geographies, "*" survey_type e.g. "acs" "dec" survey_or_table_code e.g. "acs5" "pl" year year survey ... <[`dynamic dots`][rlang::dyn-dots]> items pass query

title: Create an API call to send to api.census.gov — census_api_url
text: one URL, string

title: Create an API call to send to api.census.gov — census_api_url
code: census_api_url(paste0("B25003_00", 1:3, "E"),               "tract",               "*",               "acs",               "acs5",               2020L,               state = 55L,               county = 101L) #> [1] "https://api.census.gov/data/2020/acs/acs5?get=B25003_001E,B25003_002E,B25003_003E&for=tract:*&in=state:55&in=county:101"  census_api_url(paste0("P1_00", c(1, 3, 4), "N"),               "tract",               "*",               "dec",               "pl",               2020L,               state = 55L,               county = 101L) #> [1] "https://api.census.gov/data/2020/dec/pl?get=P1_001N,P1_003N,P1_004N&for=tract:*&in=state:55&in=county:101"

code: discrete_example <- tibble::tribble( ~ PrimaryKey, ~ Dimension, ~ Order, ~ Label, ~ Synonym, 1L, 1L, 1L, "A", NA, 2L, 1L, 2L, "B", NA, 3L, 1L, 3L, "C", NA, 4L, 1L, NA, "Alpha", 1L, 5L, 1L, NA, "Beta", 2L, 6L, 1L, NA, "Gamma", 3L, 7L, 1L, NA, "\u03B1", 4L ) synonyms <- find_synonyms(discrete_example) dplyr::slice(discrete_example, synonyms) #> # A tibble: 7 × 5 #>   PrimaryKey Dimension Order Label Synonym #>        <int>     <int> <int> <chr>   <int> #> 1          1         1     1 A          NA #> 2          2         1     2 B          NA #> 3          3         1     3 C          NA #> 4          1         1     1 A          NA #> 5          2         1     2 B          NA #> 6          3         1     3 C          NA #> 7          1         1     1 A          NA

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ set_environment_variable("SECRET_KEY" = "111111abc", install = TRUE) # First time, reload your environment so you can use the key without restarting R. readRenviron("~/.Renviron") # You can check it with: Sys.getenv("SECRET_KEY") } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # If you need to overwrite an existing key: set_environment_variable("SECRET_KEY", "111111abc", overwrite = TRUE, install = TRUE) # First time, relead your environment so you can use the key without restarting R. readRenviron("~/.Renviron") # You can check it with: Sys.getenv("SECRET_KEY") } # }
